Matthew 1:18.verse: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was on this wise: When as his mother Mary was *espoused* to Joseph, before they came together, she was found with child of the Holy Ghost.

methods.definition: to woo her and ask her in marriage
methods.characters: Jesus Christ, Mary, Joseph, Holy Ghost

John 3:16.verse: For *God* so loved the *world*, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.

methods.context: Gen 1:1, In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.
methods.opposites: The opposite of God is nothing.

methods.context: 1 John 2:15-17, Love not the world, neither the things that are in the world.
methods.opposites: The opposite of the world without form, and void.

John 3:17.verse: For *God* sent not his Son into the *world* to condemn the world; but that the world through him might be saved.

methods.context: Gen 1:1, In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.
methods.opposites: The opposite of God is nothing.

methods.context: 1 John 2:15-17, Love not the world, neither the things that are in the world.
methods.opposites: The opposite of the world without form, and void.

1 Corinthians 2:14.verse: But the *natural man* receiveth not the things of the Spirit of God: for they are foolishness unto him: neither can he know them, because they are spiritually discerned.

methods.definition: The natural man is the soul man (GCBI)

2 Corinthians 5:8.verse: We are *confident*, I say, and willing rather to be absent from the body, and to be present with the Lord.

2 Corinthians 11:2.verse: For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have *espoused* you to one husband, that I may present you as a chaste virgin to Christ.

1 John 3:14.verse: We know that we have passed from death unto life, because we love the brethren. He that loveth not his brother abideth in death.
